page.title: 07CREATION OF NATURE RESERVE 1
page.content:
During 1984 the London Borough of Hillingdon announced its proposals to sell school land in this Borough for building development.
A piece of "waste" ground belonging to this school (West Drayton Primary) was among those to be sold. Our Parent Teachers Association worked hard to prevent this action taking place and after many petitions and meetings with the Council, have saved the land.
We now have one and a quarter acres of stinging nettles and brambles to reclaim as a Nature Reserve. So far we have cleared one small patch about 6m by 4m and planted flowers to attract butterflies. We have made several paths so that children can walk through and find interesting things to watch and draw.
